Graduate Home / Explore Graduate Programs / Family Primary Care Nurse Practitioner, MSN (Online)

Family Primary Care Nurse Practitioner, MSN (Online)

Degree

Master of Science in Nursing

Schools

Graduate, Global, and Online EducationNursing and Health Sciences

Department

Nursing

At a Glance

Through a combination of courses and clinical experiences, you’ll learn to expertly develop health interventions and evaluate health care outcomes for individuals across the lifespan — from infants to the elderly. Complete this 47-credit degree program in two full-time academic years, including two summers. Once you’re done, you’ll be ready to sit for a Family Nurse Practitioner national certification exam.

Program Coordinator: Judy Harkins, gradnurse@tcnj.edu

Duration

  • full time: 2 years
  • part time: 2.5–3 years

Availability

  • online

Practicum

  • 715 hours

14

  • courses

47

  • credits

$714

  • per credit

Who Should Pursue This Program?

This program is a good fit if you’re an RN with a bachelor’s degree in nursing who wants to expand your skills and knowledge to focus on the health of both individuals and families.

Engaged Faculty

Learn from nationally and internationally recognized faculty who are fully engaged with their students. Your professor knows your name and teaches all of your classes. You won’t find any TAs here.

Application Requirements

For your application to be considered complete, you must submit the online application as well as all supplemental documents. TCNJ takes a holistic approach to reviewing our applicants, considering students’ abilities and involvement beyond academics.

Minimum Criteria:

  • A bachelor of science in nursing from an accredited university or college with a GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale
  • RN licensure
  • Official transcripts from all prior institutions
  • References from two individuals who can evaluate your academic performance, relevant work experience, and/or ability to pursue graduate study.
  • Work experience: Minimum of 6 months as an RN or 1 year of employment in a direct patient care area (including patient care assistant or tech)
  • Student essay
  • Resume/CV
  • The application fee is currently $75.  Applications can only be reviewed with payment of this non-refundable fee. This fee is waived for students who formerly enrolled at TCNJ and for specific programs.

» See all application requirements

Recommended Application Deadlines

We consider applications on a space-available basis. You can apply up to and including the first day of the semester.

» See deadlines

Curriculum

This post-baccalaureate (BSN) option prepares graduates to provide primary care to individuals and families across the lifespan. After completing the program, graduates can sit for the Family Nurse Practitioner national certification exam.

The 47-credit master’s program consists of:

  • NURS 501: Perspectives in Advanced Practice Nursing
  • NURS 503: Pharmacology for Advanced Nursing Practice
  • NURS 504: Advanced Human Pathophysiology
  • NURS 506: Theoretical Foundations of Advanced Nursing Practice and Research
  • NURS 603: Individual, Family, and Community Systems
  • NURS 604: Research and Evidence-Based Nursing for Advanced Nursing Practice
  • NURS 633: Advanced Holistic Health Assessment
  • NURS 636: Primary Care I
  • NURS 637: Primary Care III
  • NURS 638: Primary Care II
  • NURS 643: Primary Care of the Childbearing Family
  • NURS 690: Practicum in the Nurse Practitioner Role
  • NURS 694: Capstone Seminar
  • NURS 705: Capstone Project in Nursing

Code: NURS_MSN01

Tuition/Aid

We offer the same tuition rates no matter where you live. And there are a range of financial aid and assistantship options for TCNJ graduate students.

» Learn more about tuition, assistantships, and aid

Accreditation

The baccalaureate degree program in nursing/master’s degree program in nursing at The College of New Jersey are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington DC 20001. 202-887-6791
